comments:
Build: Candidate driver for 4.2.1 (TPTP-4.2.1-200609071820A)

When I try to run JUnit/AGR test suite on SUSE ES 9, I get the following exception many times in my teminal window:


java.io.IOException: Invalid argument
        at sun.nio.ch.FileChannelImpl.transferTo0(Native Method)
        at sun.nio.ch.FileChannelImpl.transferToDirectly(FileChannelImpl.java:408)
        at sun.nio.ch.FileChannelImpl.transferTo(FileChannelImpl.java:503)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.local.file.FileManagerLocal.copyFile(FileManagerLocal.java:29)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.local.file.FileManagerLocal.putFile(FileManagerLocal.java:349)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.local.file.FileManagerLocal.putFile(FileManagerLocal.java:293)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.harness.JavaExecutionDeploymentAdapter.deployFile(JavaExecutionDeploymentAdapter.java:427)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.harness.JavaExecutionDeploymentAdapter.deployToNode(JavaExecutionDeploymentAdapter.java:496)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.harness.JavaExecutionDeploymentAdapter.deployTestAssets(JavaExecutionDeploymentAdapter.java:469)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.harness.util.ExecutionAdapterUtilities.adaptExecutionDeployment(ExecutionAdapterUtilities.java:159)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.harness.TestExecutionHarness.launchTestExecution(TestExecutionHarness.java:1973)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.harness.TestExecutionHarness.access$3(TestExecutionHarness.java:1817)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.harness.TestExecutionHarness$2.run(TestExecutionHarness.java:741)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

I'm using:

Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.2)
Classic VM (build 1.4.2, J2RE 1.4.2 IBM build cxia321420-20040626 (JIT enabled: jitc))
I was able to run the same test using a standalone installation of AC

With IAC, the local file manager is used rather than the FSS (file system services) subsystem I wrote.

Therefore the issue is either coming from the local file manager or the Java test deployment adapter code.  Reassigning to Joe Toomey to make the call on who should get it (Samson for the file manager local or himself for the test parts).

Also, it might be worthwhile in the future to use FSS for all use cases and not have a special implementation for the local version.  FSS works locally and can be started on its own local port.

Scott,

I don't think you re-assigned it to Joe.
Let me give it a try

This is Samson's IAC fle transfer code.  If it works properly with the full AC (using FSS), then it's another opportunity to question why we have two substantial bodies of code doing the same thing.  If the AC's FSS needs further refactoring to incorporate it into the IAC, then feel free to file a defect for the changes you require.

I can run JUnit test cases successfully on RHEL 4 with IBM JDK 1.4.2 SR6:

java version "1.4.2"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.2)
Classic VM (build 1.4.2, J2RE 1.4.2 IBM build cxia32142-20060824 (SR6) (JIT enabled: jitc))

This is a much newer JDK than what you are using. Can you upgrage your JDK to SR6?

Created an attachment (id=50560)
The plugin containing the test suites

I tried with 
java version "1.4.2"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.2)
Classic VM (build 1.4.2, J2RE 1.4.2 IBM build cxia32142-20060824 (SR6) (JIT enabled: jitc))

and I got the following in my terminal window:
JVMDG217: Dump Handler is Processing Signal 11 - Please Wait.
JVMDG303: JVM Requesting Java core file


The launch progress got stuck at 57%.  I'm attaching the plug-in that contains the JUnit test suite that I'm launching.  Samson, please come and see so that I can show you which machine I'm able to reproduce this problem on.

Thanks.

I confirmed with Samson that this was a JRE issue.  Using an updated JRE resolved the problem.

Thanks Samson for investigating this.
ACTION: Please update the target to the release AND iteration that this defect was returned/fixed.
Reporter: Please verify and close in preparation for shutting down the TPTP 4.4 release.  Thanks.

Closing by default since not verified/closed by the originator in the 6+ months since being resolved.  

Please reopen if the issue is still present in the latest TPTP release or the
resolution is not correct.
